page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In Eastern Green many streets are named after past prominent members of the community. {Morgans Close_}Mrs Elizabeth Morgan financed the building of St Andrew's church.{William Bree Rd_}Archdeacon Bree gave the land for the church. {Sutton Avenue}_Rev.Sutton initial incumbant 1875_1913.{Despard Rd._ Rev.Despard vicar 1914_37{.Mellowship {Rd_}Rev Mellowship 1944 _50. {Thornton Close_}Hugh Thornton Headmaster at St.Andrew's School at start of 20th century.{Frederick Neal {Avenue-}farmer & landowner.{Holmes {Drive}_Eubacious Holmes, first pupil of St.Andrew's school to gain a university degree (B'ham). At Millison's Wood, the site of the former{Triumph Motor Cycle factory, roads are being named after their machines{e.g.Bonnevile Close.
